title: Efficient Data Utilization Strategies Based on Financial Modeling and Semi-Supervised Learning for [K-12]

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic statistics and financial risk management, with data analysis experience using Python/R
context.additional_context: Theory-practice parallel education using mobile devices in limited-technology environments, focusing on solving field problems in finance with scarce labeled data but abundant unlabeled data

learning_goals: Learners will improve the predictive accuracy of financial models by at least 15% in environments with limited labeled data using semi-supervised learning principles.

Learners will demonstrate improved results in at least three evaluation metrics (accuracy, precision, recall) compared to the standard MRE when implementing a debt default prediction model using the extended Minimum Relative Entropy (MRE) method.
Learners will write a comparative analysis report on model performance after applying semi-supervised learning techniques to real financial datasets.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
